name: Grimm's conjecture
rephrased: Consecutive composite numbers can be covered by distinct primes.
implication_form: If there exists a sequence of n consecutive composite numbers, then there exists a set of n distinct primes, each dividing one of the composite numbers in the sequence.
explained: Grimm's conjecture states that for any sequence of k consecutive composite numbers, there exists a way to assign to each composite number a distinct prime divisor of that composite number.
